comments.text:
Created attachment 513058
comparison of scrollbars in firefox and notepad w/ 32px thumbs

Build identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b12pre) Gecko/20110216 Firefox/4.0b12pre

this is based on gmail's autotranslate pref setting which has size=3.

I'm using large scrollbars.

steps:
[part one, configure Windows]
1. get windows7starter - this comes with your average touch tablet (such as the lenovo S10-3t available for free from MeeGo Summit 2010 Dublin)
2. open control panel
3. open display
4. change fonts to 125% (Medium)
5. change color scheme
6. advanced
7. item: scrollbar
8. size: 32
the reason to change the size of the scrollbar is that otherwise it's pretty much impossible to use your thumb to drag it.
9. ok
10. ok

[part two, test firefox - option a - gmail]
1. load gmail settings: https://mail.google.com/mail/?shva=1#settings
2. look at Auto-translation preferences:
(you need to have at least 4 items in this list)

[part two, test firefox - option b - use data url]
1. load this bug's url - it's easier for comparison purposes than option a

[part two, test firefox - option c - use the bugzilla comment field]
1. you could just adjust the bugzilla comment field (after filling in some text - e.g. by copying this comment)

[part three, test notepad]
1. open notepad
2. paste the contents of this bug comment (or just the numbers 1..6 on individual lines)
3. adjust the vertical size of notepad so that it can show 1, 2, 3, 4 lines of text

expected results:
1. there should be a scrollbar visible - this indicates to the user that there's something to scroll
2. the scrollbar should paint arrows even if there's no room for a scroll track
3. if necessary, the arrows should be compressed wrt the direction of scrolling such that they fit.
